predictions.text: BLS will report U.S. Dec 2025 nonfarm payroll employment growth between +100,000 and +225,000 (inclusive) AND an unemployment rate between 3.7% and 4.0% (inclusive).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the BLS Employment Situation release for December 2025 shows (1) total nonfarm payrolls change within [100k, 225k] and (2) U-3 unemployment rate within [3.7%, 4.0%]. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Near-term focus on the upcoming U.S. jobs report as a key rate/market catalyst (CNBC, 2026-01-08): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/08/the-december-jobs-report-is-due-out-friday-what-its-expected-to-show.html
Recent productivity and unit labor cost dynamics influence labor-market expectations (BLS, 2026-01-08): https://www.bls.gov/news.release/archives/prod2_01082026.htm
monitoring_signals: Consensus estimates (Bloomberg/Reuters) for Dec payrolls and unemployment rate
ADP private payrolls and weekly initial claims trend leading into the release
CME FedWatch and front-end rates reaction expectations
predictions.rationale: A moderate payroll print and stable jobless rate best matches late-2025 disinflationary labor-cost data while avoiding an abrupt labor-market break.

predictions.text: China’s PBoC will announce at least one reserve-requirement ratio (RRR) cut of at least 25 bps for banks by 2026-06-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the PBoC (or State Council/PBoC joint notice) publicly announces an RRR reduction (broad-based or targeted) where the stated cut size is ≥0.25 percentage points, anytime from 2026-01-09 through 2026-06-30. Otherwise NO.
evidence: China inflation acceleration complicates stimulus but uneven demand persists (CNBC, 2026-01-09): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/09/china-december-inflation-cpi-ppi-prices-demand-weakness.html
monitoring_signals: PBoC press conferences and policy statements
China credit impulse, TSF growth, and property indicators
Onshore interbank rates (DR007) and CGB yields
predictions.rationale: Even with firmer CPI, policymakers may favor quantity tools (RRR) over aggressive rate cuts to support credit creation.

predictions.text: The White House/DOD FY2027 budget request will propose total U.S. national defense budget authority of at least $1.05 trillion (USD).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the administration’s FY2027 budget documents (OMB/DOD) or an official budget fact sheet state total national defense budget authority (including DOD and defense-related spending as defined in the request) ≥ $1.05T. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Market chatter around a potential $1.5T military budget and investor uncertainty over Congressional approval (CNBC, 2026-01-08): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/08/defense-stocks-trump-military-spending-europe-us.html
monitoring_signals: OMB budget release timing and topline figures
DOD comptroller briefings and budget tables
NDAA/appropriations hearings signaling attainable toplines
predictions.rationale: Political signaling is pushing higher spending, but process constraints make a $1.05T+ request plausible rather than likely.

predictions.text: A senior U.S. administration economic official (President, Treasury Secretary, NEC Director, or FHFA Director) will publicly endorse a plan to purchase at least $100 billion of agency MBS (mortgage-backed securities) to lower mortgage rates, by 2026-06-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if an on-the-record public statement (speech, press conference, official interview, or official release) from one of the named officials explicitly supports a plan/initiative to buy ≥$100B of agency MBS with the stated intent of reducing mortgage rates. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Trump-backed idea discussed to buy ~$200B of mortgage bonds; execution unclear (CNBC, 2026-01-08): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/08/trump-mortgage-bonds-rates-fannie-freddie.html
monitoring_signals: Treasury/FHFA public remarks and policy papers
White House economic speeches on housing affordability
Agency MBS market commentary and policy leaks (Reuters/Bloomberg)
predictions.rationale: If housing affordability becomes a priority narrative, explicit endorsement could emerge even if implementation faces institutional barriers.

predictions.text: GM will lower (cut) its previously stated 2026 capital expenditure guidance by at least $2.0B in a quarterly earnings release/call or an SEC filing, by 2026-07-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if GM, in an earnings release/call transcript or SEC filing, updates 2026 capex guidance such that the midpoint is ≥$2.0B lower than the last guidance midpoint stated before 2026-01-09. Otherwise NO.
evidence: GM is taking $7.1B in Q4 charges tied to EV pullback and China restructuring (CNBC, 2026-01-08): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/08/gm-q4-charges-ev-china.html
monitoring_signals: GM earnings dates and guidance updates
Supplier/capacity announcements and battery JV capex plans
EV inventory and pricing trends in the U.S.
predictions.rationale: A strategic EV recalibration and restructuring charges increase the odds of formal capex reprioritization in 2026 guidance.

predictions.text: NetBlocks (or Cloudflare Radar) will report an Iran-wide internet connectivity disruption of at least 50% lasting 12+ consecutive hours, by 2026-03-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if NetBlocks or Cloudflare Radar publishes analysis indicating Iran’s national connectivity dropped by ≥50% versus baseline and remained at or below that level for ≥12 consecutive hours within the period. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Iran experienced an internet shutdown amid escalating protests (NYT, 2026-01-08): https://www.nytimes.com/2026/01/08/world/middleeast/iran-protests-internet-shutdown.html
monitoring_signals: NetBlocks alerts and Cloudflare Radar country dashboards
Social media reports of throttling/shutdowns corroborated by monitoring groups
Protest intensity indicators and security-force escalation
predictions.rationale: Recent use of shutdowns during unrest raises recurrence risk in the near term if protests persist or intensify.

predictions.text: Ukraine’s NABU (National Anti-Corruption Bureau) or SAPO will publicly confirm opening a formal proceeding/investigation referencing the major Ukrainian lithium project award reported as linked to Trump-associated investors, by 2026-06-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if NABU or SAPO publicly announces (press release, official statement, or public registry confirmation) a proceeding that explicitly references the named lithium project award/contract described in major reporting. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Reporting highlighted political sensitivity and conflict-of-interest risk around a major lithium project award (NYT, 2026-01-08): https://www.nytimes.com/2026/01/08/world/europe/trump-lauder-ukraine-lithium.html
monitoring_signals: NABU/SAPO press releases and public case registries
Ukrainian parliamentary oversight activity and media follow-ups
International donor conditionality statements on governance
predictions.rationale: High-profile strategic-minerals deals attract scrutiny, but formal confirmation thresholds make this a lower-probability call.

predictions.text: A U.S. government entity (DFC, EXIM, DOE, or State Department) will announce financing/insurance/grant support totaling at least $100 million (USD) for a Greenland-based critical minerals or rare-earths project, by 2026-09-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if DFC/EXIM/DOE/State announces a package (loan, guarantee, insurance, grant, or combined) with total stated value ≥$100M for a project physically located in Greenland and explicitly described as critical minerals/rare earths. Otherwise NO.
evidence: U.S. interest in Greenland critical minerals underscores strategic supply-chain competition (CNBC, 2026-01-08): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/08/-greenland-critical-minerals-mining-amaroq-us-government.html
monitoring_signals: DFC/EXIM board approvals and press releases
State Department critical minerals diplomacy announcements
Greenland mining permitting milestones and offtake MOUs
predictions.rationale: Geopolitical interest is rising, but project readiness and local politics make large near-term U.S. financing uncertain.

predictions.text: A U.S. federal science agency (NSF, NOAA, or DOE) will award or announce competitive funding totaling at least $20 million for ocean alkalinity enhancement / “antacids for the sea” style ocean carbon removal research, by 2026-12-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if NSF/NOAA/DOE publicly announces new awards/solicitations with awarded (or committed) total funding ≥$20M explicitly for ocean alkalinity enhancement or ocean alkalinization carbon-removal R&D/pilots. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Growing attention to ocean alkalinity/geoengineering approaches and governance challenges (NYT, 2026-01-08): https://www.nytimes.com/2026/01/08/magazine/ocean-acidification-carbon-geoengineering.html
monitoring_signals: Grants.gov and agency solicitations (NSF/NOAA/DOE)
ARPA-E/DOE OCED carbon removal program updates
Congressional appropriations language mentioning ocean CDR
predictions.rationale: Interest is increasing, but consolidated funding at the $20M+ scale depends on program structure and appropriations timing.

predictions.text: NASA’s Aerospace Safety Advisory Panel (ASAP) will explicitly reference the expedited Crew-11 return due to a medical issue in a publicly posted meeting transcript, minutes, or presentation, by 2026-03-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if ASAP public materials (PDF slides, minutes, transcript, or webcast documentation) contain an explicit mention of the Crew-11 early return/medical situation described by NASA reporting, within the period. Otherwise NO.
evidence: NASA planned to return ISS astronauts weeks early due to a medical issue (CNBC, 2026-01-08): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/08/nasa-iss-crew-11-astronauts-earth-medical-situation.html
monitoring_signals: ASAP meeting agendas and posted slide decks
NASA ISS program status briefings
NASA OIG or mishap reporting references (if any)
predictions.rationale: ASAP routinely discusses notable operational risk events; a medical-driven schedule change is likely to be acknowledged in oversight materials.
